title: Strengthening Hospitality Practical Competencies: Computer-Based Language Instruction Design for Prospective Adult Educators

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: The language education content development process can be explained using Morrison, Ross, and Kemp's nonlinear instructional design model.
Computer education materials based on smartphones can be designed and prototyped in limited technological environments.
Project-based assessment rubrics can be developed for language education scenarios targeting pre-service teachers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
